member.name: T:Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.IAccountClientManager
member.summary: Defines the methods that are used to work with a social network account.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.IAccountClientManager.BeginGetAccountCredentials(Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.Requests.GetAccountCredentialsRequest)
member.summary: Initializes the process of receiving the social network account credentials.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.IAccountClientManager.EndGetAccountCredentials(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the account credentials by request id.
member.param: The request id returned in the query string at the end of the flow.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.IConnectorClientManager
member.summary: Defines the methods that are used to log in users with social networks or attach social network profiles for existing users.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.IConnectorClientManager.LogOnUser(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Logs the user in the specified network. If the user account doesn’t exist, it will be created.
member.param: The URL, where the user will be redirected after login.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.IConnectorClientManager.LogOnUser(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Logs the user in the specified network. If the user account doesn’t exist, it will be created.
member.param: The URL, where the user will be redirected after login.
The additional parameters, which will be kept during the authentication flow.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.IConnectorClientManager.LogOnUser(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Logs the user in the specified network. If the user account doesn’t exist, it will be created.
member.param: The URL, where the user will be redirected after login.
if set to true a social profile will be updated asynchronously.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Social.Client.Domain.IConnectorClientManager.LogOnUser(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Logs the user in the specified network. If the user account doesn’t exist, it will be created.
member.param: The URL, where the user will be redirected after login.
if set to true a social profile will be updated asynchronously.
The additional parameters, which will be kept during the authentication flow.

member.summary: Logs the user in the specified network with the specified application credentials. If the user account doesn’t exist, it will be created.
member.param: The URL, where the user will be redirected after login.

member.param: The URL, where the user will be redirected after login.

member.summary: Gets the context data.
member.remarks: During the receiving account credentials process you'll be redirected on a domain of social network and then redirected back. Use this storage if you want to keep any data during this process.
